column4: how do i get rid of fusion without it messing up my system? without it taking away  the title bars on windos and the close minimize buttons as it would happen like before when checked none onthe effects dialogue
make sure you set another Window Manager BEFORE you remove it.
are you in KDE or gnome?
check your system tray, there should be a blue looking box type thing.
what do i do now? i went ot system preferences and the last tab says windows
best way is ps ax | grep compiz-fusion
letme open the terminal and i'll do that
if its not running it will return nothing, if it is, it will show which process it is
7649 pts/0    D+     0:00 grep compiz-fusion
ok its running. in that same terminal type compiz-fusion-icon
wait a minute no its not
command not found
ok System > Preferences > Appearence
yes
goto the last tab on the main window (Visual Effects)
what does it say
it says normal
hit the top one (None)
it will turn all effects off
then you need to restart your session
without the effects
by restart sesion you mean log out and in again or restart?
yes.
sorry log out
